How_To_Do_It: Type the pattern you want in the first cell, then press Ctrl+E
Why_Its_Useful: Excel reads your mind! It auto-fills patterns like splitting names, reformatting dates, or extracting text. Saves hours of manual work!

How_To_Do_It: Ctrl+Arrow keys to jump to the edge of data; Ctrl+Home goes to A1; Ctrl+End goes to last used cell
Why_Its_Useful: Stop scrolling like its 1999! Navigate huge spreadsheets in seconds.

How_To_Do_It: Ctrl+Shift+End selects from current cell to last used cell; Ctrl+A selects current region
Why_Its_Useful: Perfect for when you need to grab everything without missing hidden rows.

How_To_Do_It: Double-click the fill handle (small square at cell corner) instead of dragging
Why_Its_Useful: Excel automatically fills down to match adjacent column length. Your wrist will thank you!

How_To_Do_It: Select cells and look at the status bar (bottom right) for instant Sum, Average, Count
Why_Its_Useful: No formula needed for quick calculations! Right-click status bar to add more stats.

How_To_Do_It: Press F4 or Ctrl+Y to repeat your last action
Why_Its_Useful: Applied formatting to one row? F4 applies it to the next. Game changer for repetitive tasks!

How_To_Do_It: Select formatted cell, click Format Painter (or Ctrl+Shift+C), then click target. Double-click painter to apply multiple times
Why_Its_Useful: Copy complex formatting in one click instead of recreating it manually.

How_To_Do_It: Right-click > Format Cells > Custom. Use codes like #,##0 or 0.00% or dd-mmm-yyyy
Why_Its_Useful: Display numbers YOUR way without changing actual values. Show millions as 5.2M or hide zeros!

How_To_Do_It: Select data > Home > Format as Table, or use Conditional Formatting with =MOD(ROW(),2)=0
Why_Its_Useful: Makes data way easier to read. Your eyes will thank you during long data sessions!

How_To_Do_It: Home > Wrap Text, then adjust row height. Or use Alt+Enter for manual line breaks within a cell
Why_Its_Useful: No more truncated text or super-wide columns. Keep everything visible and neat.

How_To_Do_It: Copy data, right-click destination, Paste Special > Transpose (or paste then Ctrl, then T)
Why_Its_Useful: Flip rows to columns or vice versa instantly. Magic for reorganizing data!

How_To_Do_It: Home > Clear > Clear Formats, or Ctrl+Space after selecting
Why_Its_Useful: Remove all formatting but keep your data. Great for cleaning up messy imported data.

How_To_Do_It: Press F4 while editing a reference to toggle between A1, $A$1, $A1, A$1
Why_Its_Useful: Stop formulas from breaking when you copy them! F4 is your best friend here, Aryan!

How_To_Do_It: =XLOOKUP(what_to_find, where_to_look, what_to_return, if_not_found)
Why_Its_Useful: Its VLOOKUP but better - looks left or right, has built-in error handling, and doesnt need column numbers!

How_To_Do_It: =IF(AND(A1>10, B1<5), Yes, No) or =IF(OR(A1=Red, A1=Blue), Color, Other)
Why_Its_Useful: Combine conditions like a pro. AND means all must be true; OR means any can be true.

How_To_Do_It: Use & or CONCAT or TEXTJOIN. Example: =A1 & - & B1 or =TEXTJOIN(-, TRUE, A1:C1)
Why_Its_Useful: TEXTJOIN is amazing - handles ranges and ignores blanks. Much cleaner than old CONCATENATE!

How_To_Do_It: Convert data to Table (Ctrl+T), then formulas use names like =[@Sales]*[@Quantity]
Why_Its_Useful: Readable formulas that auto-expand! No more confusing cell references.

How_To_Do_It: =IFERROR(your_formula, Show this if error) Example: =IFERROR(A1/B1, N/A)
Why_Its_Useful: Hide ugly #DIV/0! or #N/A errors. Makes your spreadsheets look professional!

How_To_Do_It: Ctrl+; inserts todays date; Ctrl+Shift+; inserts current time
Why_Its_Useful: Timestamp your work instantly. No typing required!

How_To_Do_It: Data > Data Validation > List, then enter options separated by commas or select a range
Why_Its_Useful: Create dropdown menus for consistent data entry. No more typos or variations!

How_To_Do_It: Just start typing - Excel suggests matching entries from the column. Press Enter to accept
Why_Its_Useful: Excel remembers what youve typed before. Faster entry and fewer typos!

How_To_Do_It: Type first value(s), select, drag fill handle. Hold Ctrl while dragging for different behavior
Why_Its_Useful: Create sequences of numbers, dates, days, months automatically. Excel predicts the pattern!

How_To_Do_It: Select all target cells first, type your value, then press Ctrl+Enter
Why_Its_Useful: Fill 100 cells with the same value in one keystroke. Massive time saver!

How_To_Do_It: Select cells > Name Box (left of formula bar) > type a name. Use in formulas like =SUM(MonthlySales)
Why_Its_Useful: Reference data by meaningful names instead of cryptic cell addresses. Much easier to read and maintain!

How_To_Do_It: Select data and click the Quick Analysis button (bottom-right) or press Ctrl+Q
Why_Its_Useful: Instant access to formatting, charts, totals, tables, and sparklines. Excel does the thinking!

How_To_Do_It: Insert > Screenshot lets you capture any open window directly into Excel
Why_Its_Useful: Grab screenshots without leaving Excel. Perfect for documentation or dashboards!

How_To_Do_It: Select cells > Quick Access Toolbar > Speak Cells (add from All Commands)
Why_Its_Useful: Excel reads your data aloud! Great for proofreading or accessibility. Seriously cool feature!

How_To_Do_It: Formulas > Watch Window > Add Watch
Why_Its_Useful: Monitor specific cells while working elsewhere in huge workbooks. See changes in real-time!

How_To_Do_It: View > Custom Views > Add
Why_Its_Useful: Save different display settings (hidden rows, zoom, filters) and switch between them instantly!

How_To_Do_It: Data > What-If Analysis > Goal Seek
Why_Its_Useful: Work backwards! Tell Excel what result you want and itll figure out the input needed. Mind = blown!
